column2: ENGLISH
Organisation of Islamic Cooperation Member
Organisation of Islamic Cooperation Chairman
Establish the Organisation of Islamic Cooperation

The Organisation of Islamic Cooperation (OIC) is the second largest inter-governmental organization after the United Nations with a membership of 57 states spread over four continents. The Organization is the collective voice of the Muslim world. It endeavors to safeguard and protect the interests of the Muslim world in the spirit of promoting international peace and harmony among various people of the world. The Organization was established upon a decision of the historical summit which took place in Rabat, Kingdom of Morocco on 12th Rajab 1389 Hijra (25 September 1969) following the criminal arson of Al-Aqsa Mosque in occupied Jerusalem.

OIC - Economic Growth Focus
OIC - Research exchange & Political Reform Focus
OIC - Human Rights & Welfare Focus
Change Organisation of Islamic Cooperation Focus

Since we are the chairman of the Organisation of Islamic Cooperation, perhaps we should use that power to change the Organisation of Islamic Cooperation focus to better suit our country's current needs?
Human Rights & Welfare Focus for the Organisation of Islamic Cooperation
Research exchange & Political Reform Focus for the Organisation of Islamic Cooperation
Economic Growth Focus for the Organisation of Islamic Cooperation
Human Rights & Welfare Focus for the Organisation of Islamic Cooperation will not help member economies much.
Research exchange & Political Reform Focus for the Organisation of Islamic Cooperation will greatly benefit the ability of our member states to make progress in human development.
Economic Growth Focus for the Organisation of Islamic Cooperation will help member states economies a lot.
